snippet: The designer Peter Copping found clever ways to incorporate military details into his clothes.
abstract: The designer Peter Copping found clever ways to incorporate military details into his clothes.
lead_paragraph: Peter Copping described his prefall collection as a series of uniforms, namely those that women have come to expect to see at Nina Ricci (pencil skirts and pretty cardigan sweaters, for example). But to reinforce his theme, Copping also found clever ways to incorporate military details into his clothes. He made epaulets out of jet beads, he introduced a floral print that hints at camouflage, and he interpreted army netting into gloves and a cutout pouf dress, seen here with the pump that Copping calls "the new peep toe."
